message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. ADA deficiency is specifically linked to Severe Combined Immunodeficiency (SCID), which is a group of rare genetic disorders that lead to a severely compromised immune system. Recurrent infections, which the child is experiencing, are common in patients with SCID. Hyper-IgM Syndrome, Wiskott-Aldrich Syndrome, and Bruton's Agammaglobulinemia are other primary immunodeficiencies but not associated with ADA deficiency.

We refer to PubMed articles on medicine for help. ADA deficiency is related to Severe Combined Immunodeficiency (SCID), which is the most common autosomal recessive mutation in this disease. Hyper-IgM Syndrome, Wiskott-Aldrich Syndrome, and Bruton's Agammaglobulinemia are all related to primary immunodeficiencies, but they are not caused by ADA deficiency.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. ADA deficiency is the most common cause of severe combined immunodeficiency (SCID), an inherited disorder characterized by a severely compromised immune system, which predisposes affected individuals to recurrent infections. Therefore, the correct answer is (A) Severe Combined Immunodeficiency. Hyper-IgM syndrome, Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome, and Bruton's agammaglobulinemia are other immune system disorders but are not directly associated with ADA deficiency.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. ADA deficiency causes Severe Combined Immunodeficiency (SCID), the most common form of which is associated with ADA deficiency. The other options are associated with different genetic mutations.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. ADA deficiency is associated with Severe Combined Immunodeficiency (SCID), which leads to recurrent infections. Hyper-IgM syndrome, Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome, and Bruton’s Agammaglobulinemia are all different types of primary immunodeficiencies but not typically associated with ADA deficiency.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. ADA deficiency is associated with Severe Combined Immunodeficiency (SCID), an autosomal recessive disease characterized by severe impairment of both B and T lymphocyte function, leading to recurrent infections.

We refer to the National Institutes of Health for help. ADA deficiency is the most common cause of Severe Combined Immunodeficiency (SCID). None of the other options are associated with ADA deficiency.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. ADA deficiency causes severe combined immunodeficiency, which is characterized by recurrent infections. It is the most common cause of severe combined immunodeficiency. The other options are caused by different genetic mutations.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. ADA deficiency is associated with Severe Combined Immunodeficiency (SCID), which is the most common autosomal recessive mutation leading to SCID. The other options are associated with different genetic mutations.
